body.p:
Head Qrs 12' Ky Infty Vols'
Strawberry Plains Tenn
30th Decr 1863
Brig Genl E E. Potter
Chf. Staff Army of the Ohio
Sir

Under the late order for recruiting "Veteran Volunteers I have been enabled to recruit at least three" fourths of the 12' Ky Infty Regiment with the Consideration that they be mounted and in order to ascertain whether this arrangement could be made or not I forwarded two applications one to the Adjt Genl of Ky and the other to the Secty of war through your Department Since which we have learned through Corps Head Qrs that after the 5th Jany 1864 the inducements for reenlisting are not so good and as it wil be imposible for us to learn by that time whether our population will be accepted or not I would respectfully ask what Steps is would be advisable to take as the Regiment will not reenlist as Infantry. If the above proposition is accepted under the fired inducements three fourths and verry probably the entire regiment will reenlist but under no other Circumstances
Will you please to give us the necessary information as soon as convienent

I am General very respectfully
Your Obt Servt
(Signed) L, H, Rousseau. Lt Col Comdg. Regt

official
E. F. Hays
Adjt 12" ky V I.

Hd. Qrs 12" Ky Infty
Strawberry Plains Decr 30/63
R 52 D of O 1864
Rosseau L H Lt Col
Comdg.
Submits statement in regard to his regiment reenlisting
E B 86 D of O 1864
Hd Qrs Dept of the Ohio
Knoxville Jan 1s 1864
If this regt will reinlist as veteran Volunteers, I will mount them as Mounted Infty. I have in power to make it a cavalry Regt

(Signed) J. G. Foster
M. G. Comdg.
Respectfully refered thru Head Qrs 3rd Divis to C. V. -- 12'Ky Infty

By command of Brig Genl J, D, Cox
(Signed) G M Bascom
Maj & a a, G
Forwarded to me by mistake and respectfy returned the 12' Ky is not in my command

O W Wilcox
B. G.
Jany 2,
Recd (Hd Qrs D O) Jany 1st 1864
